author: stefan2
msg: On the authzperf branch: Filter the authz data and construct a prefix
tree from the path rules that apply to the respective user and repository.
Statically attach the access rights to the tree nodes.
Only for a short while, we will do this filtering for each call to
svn_repos_authz_check_access.  In a few commits we will store the
information in svn_authz_t and filter only once or twice per connection
(depending on user).
* BRANCH-README
(TODO, DONE): Move implemented bits from TODO to DONE.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/authz.c
(access_t,
node_t): Initial structures used to build the path rule prefix tree.
(process_rule_baton_t,
process_rule
has_matching_rule): New code to determine whether a path rule / authz
section is relevent to the given user.
(create_node,
insert_path): New code to insert path rules into the prefix tree.
(process_path_rule_baton_t,
process_path_rule,
create_user_authz): New top-level code for authz filtering and prefix
tree constrution.
(next_segment,
lookup): The new and currently quite simple rule lookup based on
the new prefix tree data structure.
(authz_get_path_access): Drop obsolete implementation.
(svn_repos_authz_check_access): Use the new lookup code instead.
